Tata Niaga Bijih Nikel Disinyalir Hanya Menguntungkan Pemilik Smelter
07 Nov 2019, 21:15 by Heri Firmansyah


Tata Niaga Bijih Nikel Disinyalir Hanya Menguntungkan Pemilik Smelter

KBRN, Jakarta : Diskusi yang mengangkat tema tentang Kontroversi pengehentian ekspor bijih nikel dan pembangunan smelter yang diadakan di KAHMI, menjadi sorotan banyak pihak apalagi dari kalangan Asosiasi Smelter.Pengamat bisnis pertambangan, Hanifa Sutrisna mengatakan, ada indikasi permainanan perdagangan nikel di dalam negeri yang sangat merugikan negara dan pengusaha pribumi pemilik Izin Usaha Pertambangan (IUP)."Tata niaga yang tidak melindungi dan tidak berpihak kepada pemilik IUP, tetapi lebih berpihak kepada pemilik smelter," jelasnya usai mengikuti diskusi publik di kantor KAHMI di kawasan Kebayoran Baru, Jakarta Selatan, Kamis (7/11/2019).Lebih lanjut Hanifa menerangkan bahwa pemilik smelter memberlakukan perdagangan tidak langsung atau harus melalui trader dan hasil laboratorium yang sudah ditentukan pemilik smelter."Harga ditentukan oleh trader, otomatis harga ditentukan oleh pemilik smelter dan tidak mematuhi ketentuan harga yang ditetapkan pemerintah, uji lab yang ditunjuk pemilik smelter dengan merubah kadar Ni dari kadar 1.8 menjadi Ni 1.3, sehingga harga jatuh dan pembayaran pajak turun," ungkap mantan Advisor Direktur ANTAM ini. Perihal ini, ia juga mengimbau agar pemerintah segera menetapkan Harga Nikel yang acuan kepada pemilik smelter seperti harga Batu Bara Acuan yang wajib sebagai panduan pembeli batu bara dalam negeri.  "Apabila kontrak penjualan di bawah harga maka pemilik IUP yang harus menanggung sanksi, namun tidak ada sanksi bagi pembeli/pemilik smelter," sambung Hanifa, yang juga Advisor Direktur Utama Timah Industri ini.Akibatnya, harga kontrak turun sehingga pajak yang dibayarkan kepada pemerintah juga turun.
Hanifa pun mensinyalir ada permainan dagang sehingga seluruh ore akan dijual ke smelter. Akibatnya, penambang pribumi pemilik IUP tidak bisa bangun smelter, dampaknya akan rugi dan bangkrut.Mengingat akan Nawa Cita yang digagas oleh Presiden Joko Widodo selama ini, dia pun menyimpulkan bahwa kepala BKPM (Badan Koordinasi Penanaman Modal) terlalu terburu-buru mengeluarkan imbauan tanpa berkoordinasi dengan lembaga-lembaga terkait."Hal ini jelas-jelas membuat gaduh suasana dan hal ini pun sangat bertentangan dengan arahan Pak Jokowi yang tidak menginginkan kegaduhan yang dilakukan oleh menteri atau setingkat menteri di periode kedua pemerintahan beliau," tegasnya.Fatalnya lagi, sang pengamat Bisnis Pertambangan ini pun menyayangkan akan regulasi kebijakan oleh pihak BKPM seperti penghentian ekspor biji nikel. "Apa dasar hukumnya BKPM menghentikan ekspor bijih nikel yang bukan kewenangannya," tandasnya.

Nickel Ore Trading System Allegedly Only Benefits Smelter Owners
Nov 7 2019, 21:15 by Heri Firmansyah


Nickel Ore Trading System Allegedly Only Benefits Smelter Owners

KBRN, Jakarta: Discussion with the theme of the Controversy over the cessation of nickel ore exports and the construction of smelters held at KAHMI, became the spotlight of many parties especially from the Smelter Association. Mining business observer, Hanifa Sutrisna said, there are indications of the nickel trade in the country that is very detrimental to the state and indigenous entrepreneurs who own Mining Business Permits (IUP). "A business system that does not protect and does not favor IUP owners, but rather sides with smelter owners," he explained after attending a public discussion at the KAHMI office in Kebayoran Baru, South Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019). Furthermore, Hanifa explained that the smelter owner imposed indirect trading or had to go through traders and laboratory results determined by the smelter owner. "Prices are determined by traders, automatically the price is determined by the smelter owner and does not comply with price terms. established by the government, designated lab tests "Smelter owners change Ni levels from 1.8 to Ni 1.3, so prices fall and tax payments fall," said the former ANTAM Advisor Director. Regarding this, he also appealed to the government to immediately set the Nickel Price as a reference to smelter owners such as the Reference Coal price which is mandatory as a guide for domestic coal buyers. "If the sales contract is below the price, the IUP owner must bear the sanction, but there is no sanction for the buyer / owner of the smelter," continued Hanifa, who is also the Advisor to the President Director of the Industry Lead. As a result, the contract price dropped so that the taxes paid to the government also down.
Hanifa also indicated that there was a trading game so that all the ore would be sold to smelters. As a result, indigenous miners who own IUPs cannot build smelters, the impact will be loss and bankruptcy. Bearing in mind the Nawa Cita initiated by President Joko Widodo all this time, he concludes that the head of the Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM) is too hasty in issuing an appeal without coordinating "This clearly makes the atmosphere noisy and this is also very contrary to the direction of Mr. Jokowi who did not want the commotion by the minister or ministerial level in the second period of his administration," he said.Fatal again, the observer The Mining Business also regrets the policy regulations by BKPM such as the cessation of nickel ore exports. "What is the legal basis for BKPM to stop the export of nickel ore that is not its authority," he said.
